node.excerpt: A  Button  can display either text or an icon. It can be tapped and will run an  onTap  callback when tapped. It may optionally be toggled with each tap. Props Prop Type Notes text string icon string See  Icon  below. type string See  Type  below‚Ä¶

A  CheckboxGroup  takes a set of options and turns them into a set of  RowItem s, each of which displays the option together with a  Checkbox . The CheckboxGroup‚Äôs value is an array containing all checked options. Props Prop Type Notes options string‚Ä¶
Tapping on a  Favorite  will toggle it between on and off. Props Prop Type Notes value boolean onValueChange function Examples

Welcome to the  Learn Design System  docs. In this wiki, you‚Äôll find information on each component included in the Learn Design System, together with information on colors, inputs and patterns of use. Installation Open Framer X Store and  install the‚Ä¶

An  Icon  displays a Material Design Icon. Props Prop Type Notes icon string A Material Design Icon name. See  Icon  below. color string Any color. size number The size of the icon. Icon The  icon  prop can accept either  ‚Äúnone‚Äù  or one of the‚Ä¶

The Learn Design System supports the  Material Design System‚Äôs icons . Below you‚Äôll find a list of every valid icon name. You can use these names as the  icon  prop in the  Button ,  Link  and  Icon  components. ...

An  Image  shows an image with an optional color overlay. It may also have a  Favorite . Props Prop Type Notes image string A source URL for the Image's image. overlay boolean color string A color to use for the image's overlay. favorite boolean‚Ä¶

Value Each of the input components in the Learn package accept a  value  prop. We can use this prop to set the initial value of the input, or to sync its value with another part of our project‚Äôs state. Different input components have values of‚Ä¶

A  NavigationBar  models the top navigation bar of an iOS app. The bar has a title, an optional subtitle, and two tappable areas on its left and right sides. Each of these areas may have a link, icon or both. The bar has a taller ‚Äúlarge‚Äù mode that‚Ä¶

Tapping on a  Radio  will turn it on. Radio inputs are normally used as a group in order to capture a mutually-exclusive choice, as is done in the  RadioGroup  component. Props Prop Type Notes value boolean Whether the Radio is checked. disabled‚Ä¶

A  RadioGroup  takes a set of options and turns them into a set of  RowItem s, each of which displays the option together with a  Radio . The RadioGroup‚Äôs value is the currently selected option. Props Prop Type Notes options string[] The group‚Äôs‚Ä¶

A  RowItem  displays text on the left side and an optional component on the right side: a Checkbox, Radio, Switch or Icon. Props Prop Type Notes text string value boolean The value to pass to the right component. disabled boolean validation function‚Ä¶
